title: Vintage Toasters & Irons
description: The small appliances that made mornings and laundry day a little easier

questions.question: What iconic chrome toaster, made by Sunbeam, automatically lowered bread and raised it when done without a lever?
Before the pop-up toaster was invented, what type of toaster required you to open small doors to flip the bread manually?
Who invented the first successful pop-up toaster, the Toastmaster, in 1926?
What heavy, pointed household appliance was heated on the stove before electricity and used to press wrinkles out of clothes?
What feature, added to electric irons in the 1950s, allowed users to spray a fine mist of water onto fabric while ironing?
What padded, cloth-covered board on legs was set up in the kitchen or laundry room specifically for pressing clothes?
What small toaster oven, combining a toaster and a miniature oven, became popular in kitchens during the 1970s?
What material was the soleplate (bottom) of most irons made from before non-stick coatings became common?
What was the purpose of the 'fabric selector dial' found on electric irons?
options: To set the correct temperature for different fabrics

questions.question: What did many homemakers sprinkle on clothes before ironing to help remove stubborn wrinkles?
What early electric toaster design featured exposed heating elements on the sides, with bread placed against them?
What brand manufactured the popular 'Toast-R-Oven' countertop appliance that became a 1970s kitchen staple?
What handy feature was added to electric irons in the 1980s that automatically turned the iron off if left unattended?
What did the term 'cord set' refer to on early electric irons and toasters?
options: A cord with a built-in switch

questions.question: What miniature version of a full-sized iron was designed specifically for pressing collars, cuffs, and small areas?
options: A travel iron or sleeve iron
